thread.title: By turning on the press, Donald Trump is playing with fire
thread.title_full: By turning on the press, Donald Trump is playing with fire

author: Tim Stanley
title: By turning on the press, Donald Trump is playing with fire
text:
I was at the inauguration, so was Donald Trump. We could both see that the crowd was large but nothing compared to the ones that turned out for Obama or the women’s march. So what? Who cares? The venue, Washington DC, always votes over 90 per cent Democrat and Trump’s voters would’ve had to pay a lot of money to travel there. So Trump could’ve accepted these facts and moved on. Instead he chose to dispute them – and shoot the messenger.
White House press secretary Sean Spicer marched in front on the cameras and angrily accused the media of lying about the size of the crowds. He told some lies of his own. More people used the metro for this inaugural than the last one, he said – false. This was the first year that floor coverings were used, highlighting empty areas – false.
President Donald Trump delivers his inaugural address on the West Front of the U.S. Capitol T rump struck the same tone in an inappropriately partisan speech to the CIA. Journalists, he said, are “among the most...
